1.rationale:
Thinking aloud:
My snake (#1) is currently at (7,6). The closest apple is at (8,5) which is just one step right and one step down away. By moving RIGHT first, I can then reach (8,5) with a subsequent move (by going DOWN). This apple gives a quick point and is safely positioned away from walls and the enemy snake. Also, no obstacles or own body blocks the way to (8,5). 

Thus, I'll move RIGHT to start approaching that apple.

Next move: RIGHT.

2.rationale:
Strategy: Move towards the nearest apple while avoiding the enemy snake and the edges of the board.
Next move: RIGHT

1.rationale:
I’m noticing that my head is now at (8,5) and that I need to work toward one of the nearby apples. Out of the apples at (5,4), (5,3), (4,6), (5,2), and (5,8), the apple at (5,4) is the closest (roughly 3 or 4 moves away). From (8,5), I can consider these four directions:

• UP (to (8,6)): This appears less appealing, and also my recent path seems to have come from there.
• RIGHT (to (9,5)): That would likely run into territory occupied by some part of my own snake (or potentially reverse my recent move).
• DOWN (to (8,4)): This is safe but doesn’t move me toward the apple’s x–coordinate.
• LEFT (to (7,5)): This moves me horizontally closer to (5,4) while keeping the move safe.

Moving LEFT will start closing the gap toward that closest apple at (5,4) without running into walls, the enemy at (2,5), or risking self–collision.

So, I decide my next move is: LEFT.

• Moving UP to (7,6) isn’t as direct and would increase the vertical distance.
• Moving DOWN to (7,4) is safe, but it doesn’t get me any closer on the x–axis.
• Moving RIGHT would reverse onto my own body (the tail), so that’s not allowed.

1.rationale:
I’m looking at the board from my current head, at (6,5). My main target remains the apple at (5,4), which is just 2 moves away. Here’s a quick analysis:

• If I move LEFT, I land at (5,5). That move brings me directly in the same column as (5,4). Next turn I can simply go DOWN to collect the apple, so my Manhattan distance from the target becomes 1.
• Moving DOWN would take me to (6,4), which is also safe and is 1 step horizontally away from (5,4), but then I’d need to move LEFT next. Both options make progress.
• Moving UP (to (6,6)) would increase my vertical distance from (5,4) and is less direct.
• Moving RIGHT would put me back onto my tail (or reversed body) since my previous head (now tail) is at (7,5), which is forbidden.

There’s no immediate threat from enemy Snake #2 at (4,5) along these chosen preliminary paths.

Between LEFT and DOWN the reasoning is similar, but as per my previous plan and the fact that moving LEFT puts me directly above the apple, I decide to continue the same strategy.

Decided next move: LEFT.
